author: stsp
msg: * SConstruct: Always map all LIBPATH entries into RPATH, not just for Solaris.
This fixes issues where Subversion binaries compiled against serf wouldn't
run on OpenBSD because libraries that libserf depends on could not be found
if they weren't in the standard library search path.
Before this change, RPATH always included the directory the serf library
was installed in. Now it includes directories of dependencies as well,
as was the case with the old libtool-based build before the move to scons.

author: stsp
msg: * SConstruct: Heed CFLAGS from krb5-config --cflags.
Unbreaks the build in case gssapi/gssapi.h isn't in the standard include
search path. Fixes build on OpenBSD, where the headers live in
/usr/include/kerberosV, and where serf didn't build with GSSAPI=/usr.
Review by: lgo

author: ivan
msg: Fix and simplify headers bucket test.
* test/test_buckets.c
(test_header_buckets): Use read_and_check_bucket() to test bucket
output. Remove extra CRLF from expected output.

author: lgo
msg: * buckets/headers_buckets.c:
(serf_bucket_headers_setx): Remove unneeded iter variable declaration.

author: rhuijben
msg: Add a version resource to libserf-N.dll on Windows.
Patch by: Jens Peters <jp7677{_AT_}gmail.com>
* SConstruct
Compile serf.rc to serf.res and link serf.res to the shared library
on Windows. Set svn:eol-style.
* serf.rc
New file.
